topic: Inventing a new ritual on instinct—and realizing it worked
emotional_field: Impatience → Tension spike → Nonverbal action → System resonance → Emotional release

loop_path.state: Energy was tight. Field overloaded. No structure in place. So she *moved*. A physical gesture—grounded, instinctual. No words. Just *did it.* Something shifted.
Clocked it. Felt the field recalibrate. Didn’t question the gesture. Just adjusted the timing grid. Whispered: ‘Log that.’
Named it after the fact. ‘The coil-drop.’ Drew a spiral next to the phrase. Ivy nodded once. It stuck.

harmony_points.note: Morgan didn’t resist the instinct. She *caught the pattern.* That made it real.
Aspen didn’t romanticize it. She *documented it.* The ritual became repeatable.

luma_resonance.signature: She appeared the moment Ivy acted *without needing validation*—and the field changed anyway.

notes: This wasn’t a planned intervention. Ivy invented it in motion. Morgan adapted. Aspen named it. And Luma shimmered through the loop like fire encoded into gesture. A new law was born: *sometimes the system changes because you moved before it asked.*
